items.text: The ActionBar by default now has just the title for the current activity.
items.href: Defining The ActionBar | CodePath Android Cliffnotes

items.text: The ActionBar title displayed at the top of the screen is governed by the AndroidManifest.xml file within the activity nodes.
items.href: Defining The ActionBar | CodePath Android Cliffnotes

items.text: In the example below, the activity "FirstActivity" will have an ActionBar with the string value of the resource identified by @string/activity_name.
items.href: Defining The ActionBar | CodePath Android Cliffnotes

items.text: Change the android:label or android:icon to modify the ActionBar title or icon for a given activity or for the application as a whole.
items.href: Defining The ActionBar | CodePath Android Cliffnotes

items.text: In the new Android 5.0 material design guidelines, the style guidelines have changed to discourage the use of the icon in the ActionBar.
items.href: Defining The ActionBar | CodePath Android Cliffnotes

items.text: Although the icon can be added back with:
items.href: Defining The ActionBar | CodePath Android Cliffnotes

items.text: You can read more about this on the material design guidelines which state: "The use of application icon plus title as a standard layout is discouraged on API 21 devices and newer."
items.href: Defining The ActionBar | CodePath Android Cliffnotes
